TopicTitle: Remote Tech making hard take offs :(

Articles.Content:
Hey guys, problem here, i have remote tech installed, made a ship with the remote tech command part, launch, get to 10 km, turn off SAS... and the craft immediately plunges into the ground >

is there anything wrong with my craft or SAS? craft file is below:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/43468589/Kerbol%201.craft

Nothing wrong with SAS, why do you turn it off? You can still steer with SAS enabled, it just helps to hold your heading. I don't have remote tech installed so you'd have to post a screenshot, but if you're turning off SAS and it plunges then it's likely a balance issue that the SAS can control with reaction wheel torque / control surfaces.

You shouldn't be turning off SAS in the first place.

Only thing that remote tech could complicate things with is if you don't have contact to KSC, you need antennas/dishes I'm sure you're aware.

Other question: Why are you turning SAS off?

Might be it is what kept your rocket from crashing in the first place - try launching without SAS and see if it tilts earlier, would indicate you have a different problem then remote tech.

Edit: ARGH!

You shouldn't be turning off SAS in the first place.

Depends on whether you're using RT1 or RT2. RT1 enforces old-ASAS behavior, which does need to be turned on and off.
